question.title: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "The word \"systemic\" seems to be thrown around quite a bit when speaking about social issues\u2013do most people that use it actually know what it really means?", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}

answer.content: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "I listen to a lot of Progressive talk radio. From what I\u2019ve heard to most of the hosts and callers, \u201csystemic\u201d has a very malleable definition that they change to fit their narrative needs at the time.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "The same is true for all of the -isms and -phobias: racism, sexism, homophobia, xenophobia, etc\u2026 They change the definitions at will to support whatever position they\u2019re trying to take.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Thus, they no longer define racism as \u201ctreating someone differently based upon their race,\u201d because they\u2019d have to admit that Affirmative Action-like programs are also racist. They\u2019ve added something about \u201cpower\u201d to the definition: racism is power plus prejudice.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "They\u2019ll change that, too, once it no longer supports their positions.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Once you realize that there\u2019s no pleasing the Progressives, so you just quit trying, you\u2019ll save yourself a lot of stress.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}
